ADONIS.description: Small butterfly with bright blue upperwings (males) or brown upperwings (females), and orange spots on hindwings.
ADONIS.habitat: Grasslands, meadows, and open areas with chalk or limestone soils
ADONIS.distribution: Europe, from southern England to the Mediterranean
ADONIS.diet: Nectar from flowers, especially thistles and knapweeds
ADONIS.behavior: Flies from May to September. Males are territorial. Forms colonies.
ADONIS.lifecycle: Eggs laid on horseshoe vetch. Caterpillars feed on host plant. Overwinters as pupa.

AFRICAN GIANT SWALLOWTAIL.description: Very large butterfly with black and yellow wings, long tail-like extensions on hindwings, and distinctive wing pattern.
AFRICAN GIANT SWALLOWTAIL.diet: Nectar from flowers, tree sap, and rotting fruit
AFRICAN GIANT SWALLOWTAIL.behavior: Strong flier. Males are territorial. Rarely seen at ground level.
AFRICAN GIANT SWALLOWTAIL.lifecycle: Eggs laid on Rutaceae family plants. Large caterpillars with defensive spines.

AMERICAN SNOOT.description: Small butterfly with long snout-like projection on head, brown wings with orange patches, and white spots.
AMERICAN SNOOT.habitat: Open areas, fields, and woodland edges
AMERICAN SNOOT.distribution: North and South America, from United States to Argentina
AMERICAN SNOOT.behavior: Migratory. Fast flier. Often perches with wings closed.
AMERICAN SNOOT.lifecycle: Eggs laid on hackberry trees. Caterpillars feed on leaves. Multiple generations per year.

AN 88.description: Small butterfly with black and white wings, distinctive '88' or '89' pattern on hindwings, and red markings.
AN 88.distribution: Central and South America, from Mexico to Brazil
AN 88.diet: Nectar from flowers, rotting fruit, and tree sap
AN 88.behavior: Fast flier. Males are territorial. Often seen on forest trails.
AN 88.lifecycle: Eggs laid on plants in the Urticaceae family. Caterpillars are green with spines.

APPOLLO.description: Large butterfly with white wings, black spots, red eye-spots on hindwings, and transparent wing tips.
APPOLLO.distribution: Europe and Asia, in mountainous regions
APPOLLO.diet: Nectar from flowers, especially thistles and knapweeds
APPOLLO.behavior: Slow flier. Flies from June to August. Endangered in many areas.
APPOLLO.lifecycle: Eggs laid on stonecrop plants. Caterpillars feed on host plant. Overwinters as egg or young caterpillar.

ARCIGERA FLOWER MOTH.description: Medium-sized moth with brown and white patterned wings, and distinctive flower-like markings.
ARCIGERA FLOWER MOTH.distribution: North America, from Canada to Mexico
ARCIGERA FLOWER MOTH.diet: Nectar from flowers, especially evening primroses
ARCIGERA FLOWER MOTH.behavior: Nocturnal. Attracted to lights. Flies from May to September.
ARCIGERA FLOWER MOTH.lifecycle: Eggs laid on host plants. Caterpillars feed on flowers and seeds.

ATALA.description: Small butterfly with black wings, blue-green iridescent spots, and red abdomen.
ATALA.habitat: Tropical and subtropical areas with cycad plants
ATALA.behavior: Slow flier. Forms colonies. Warning colors indicate toxicity.
ATALA.lifecycle: Eggs laid on cycad plants. Caterpillars are toxic due to cycad consumption.

ATLAS MOTH.description: Very large moth with brown, red, and white patterned wings, and distinctive snake-like wing tips.
ATLAS MOTH.distribution: Southeast Asia, from India to Indonesia
ATLAS MOTH.diet: Adults do not feed. Caterpillars feed on various trees.
ATLAS MOTH.behavior: Nocturnal. Attracted to lights. Short-lived as adults.
ATLAS MOTH.lifecycle: Large caterpillars feed on various host plants. Cocoons are made of silk.

BANDED ORANGE HELICONIAN.description: Medium-sized butterfly with orange and black banded wings, and long narrow shape.
BANDED ORANGE HELICONIAN.distribution: Central and South America, from Mexico to Brazil
BANDED ORANGE HELICONIAN.diet: Nectar from flowers, especially Lantana and Pentas
BANDED ORANGE HELICONIAN.behavior: Strong flier. Migratory. Forms aggregations at roosting sites.
BANDED ORANGE HELICONIAN.lifecycle: Eggs laid on passionflower vines. Caterpillars feed on host plant.

BANDED PEACOCK.description: Medium-sized butterfly with brown wings, white bands, and distinctive eye-spots on hindwings.
BANDED PEACOCK.habitat: Open areas, gardens, and forest edges
BANDED PEACOCK.distribution: Central and South America, from Mexico to Brazil
BANDED PEACOCK.behavior: Fast flier. Common in gardens. Flies year-round in tropical areas.
BANDED PEACOCK.lifecycle: Eggs laid on plants in the Acanthaceae family. Multiple generations per year.

BANDED TIGER MOTH.description: Medium-sized moth with black and white banded wings, and orange or yellow markings.
BANDED TIGER MOTH.distribution: North America, from Canada to Mexico
BANDED TIGER MOTH.behavior: Nocturnal. Attracted to lights. Flies from May to August.
BANDED TIGER MOTH.lifecycle: Eggs laid on various host plants. Caterpillars are woolly bears.

BECKERS WHITE.description: Small butterfly with white wings, black spots on forewings, and gray-green undersides.
BECKERS WHITE.distribution: Western North America, from Canada to Mexico
BECKERS WHITE.behavior: Fast flier. Flies from March to October. Multiple generations per year.
BECKERS WHITE.lifecycle: Eggs laid on plants in the Brassicaceae family. Caterpillars feed on host plant.

BIRD CHERRY ERMINE MOTH.description: Small white moth with black spots, and distinctive ermine-like pattern.
BIRD CHERRY ERMINE MOTH.habitat: Woodlands and areas with cherry trees
BIRD CHERRY ERMINE MOTH.diet: Adults do not feed. Caterpillars feed on cherry and related trees.
BIRD CHERRY ERMINE MOTH.behavior: Nocturnal. Can form large colonies that defoliate trees.
BIRD CHERRY ERMINE MOTH.lifecycle: Eggs laid on cherry trees. Caterpillars form communal webs. Overwinters as young caterpillar.

BLACK HAIRSTREAK.description: Small butterfly with brown wings, orange band on hindwings, and white-tipped tail.
BLACK HAIRSTREAK.diet: Nectar from flowers, honeydew from aphids
BLACK HAIRSTREAK.behavior: Flies from June to July. Rare and localized. Perches high in trees.
BLACK HAIRSTREAK.lifecycle: Eggs laid on blackthorn. Caterpillars feed on leaves. Overwinters as egg.

BLUE MORPHO.description: Very large butterfly with brilliant blue iridescent upperwings and brown undersides with eye-spots.
BLUE MORPHO.distribution: Central and South America, from Mexico to Brazil
BLUE MORPHO.diet: Nectar from flowers, rotting fruit, and tree sap
BLUE MORPHO.behavior: Strong flier. Males are territorial. Flies in forest canopy.
BLUE MORPHO.lifecycle: Eggs laid on various host plants. Large caterpillars with defensive spines.

BLUE SPOTTED CROW.description: Medium-sized butterfly with dark brown or black wings, blue spots, and white markings.
BLUE SPOTTED CROW.distribution: Southeast Asia, from India to Indonesia
BLUE SPOTTED CROW.behavior: Slow flier. Forms aggregations. Warning colors indicate toxicity.
BLUE SPOTTED CROW.lifecycle: Eggs laid on plants in the Apocynaceae family. Caterpillars are toxic.

BROOKES BIRDWING.description: Very large butterfly with black and green wings (males) or brown wings (females), and long tail-like extensions.
BROOKES BIRDWING.distribution: Southeast Asia, especially Borneo and Sumatra
BROOKES BIRDWING.behavior: Strong flier. Males are territorial. Rare and protected.
BROOKES BIRDWING.lifecycle: Eggs laid on Aristolochia plants. Large caterpillars. Protected species.

BROWN ARGUS.description: Small butterfly with brown wings, orange spots on hindwings, and white fringes.
BROWN ARGUS.distribution: Europe, from England to the Mediterranean
BROWN ARGUS.behavior: Flies from May to September. Forms colonies. Low flier.
BROWN ARGUS.lifecycle: Eggs laid on rockrose and related plants. Caterpillars feed on host plant.

BROWN SIPROETA.description: Medium-sized butterfly with brown wings, orange bands, and distinctive eye-spots.
BROWN SIPROETA.distribution: Central and South America, from Mexico to Brazil
BROWN SIPROETA.behavior: Fast flier. Common in gardens. Flies year-round in tropical areas.
BROWN SIPROETA.lifecycle: Eggs laid on plants in the Acanthaceae family. Multiple generations per year.

CABBAGE WHITE.description: Small butterfly with white wings, black spots on forewings (males) or two spots (females), and yellow-green undersides.
CABBAGE WHITE.behavior: Common garden pest. Fast flier. Multiple generations per year.
CABBAGE WHITE.lifecycle: Eggs laid on plants in the Brassicaceae family. Green caterpillars feed on leaves.

CAIRNS BIRDWING.description: Very large butterfly with black and green wings (males) or brown wings (females), and long tail-like extensions.
CAIRNS BIRDWING.distribution: Northeastern Australia and Papua New Guinea
CAIRNS BIRDWING.behavior: Strong flier. Males are territorial. Protected species.
CAIRNS BIRDWING.lifecycle: Eggs laid on Aristolochia plants. Large caterpillars. Protected in Australia.

CHALK HILL BLUE.description: Small butterfly with blue upperwings (males) or brown upperwings (females), and distinctive white fringes.
CHALK HILL BLUE.distribution: Europe, from England to the Mediterranean
CHALK HILL BLUE.behavior: Flies from July to September. Forms colonies. Low flier.
CHALK HILL BLUE.lifecycle: Eggs laid on horseshoe vetch. Caterpillars feed on host plant. Overwinters as egg.

CHECQUERED SKIPPER.description: Small butterfly with brown and orange checkered wings, and distinctive pattern.
CHECQUERED SKIPPER.diet: Nectar from flowers, especially bugle and bluebells
CHECQUERED SKIPPER.behavior: Fast flier. Flies from May to July. Low flier.
CHECQUERED SKIPPER.lifecycle: Eggs laid on grasses. Caterpillars feed on host plant. Overwinters as caterpillar.

CHESTNUT.description: Small butterfly with brown wings, orange patches, and eye-spots on hindwings.
CHESTNUT.behavior: Flies from June to August. Low flier. Forms colonies.
CHESTNUT.lifecycle: Eggs laid on grasses. Caterpillars feed on host plant. Overwinters as caterpillar.

CINNABAR MOTH.description: Medium-sized moth with black and red wings, and distinctive warning colors.
CINNABAR MOTH.distribution: Europe, Asia, and introduced to North America and Australia
CINNABAR MOTH.diet: Adults do not feed. Caterpillars feed on ragwort.
CINNABAR MOTH.behavior: Nocturnal. Flies from May to August. Warning colors indicate toxicity.
CINNABAR MOTH.lifecycle: Eggs laid on ragwort. Yellow and black striped caterpillars are toxic.

CLEARWING MOTH.description: Medium-sized moth with transparent wings, yellow and black body, and wasp-like appearance.
CLEARWING MOTH.habitat: Woodlands and areas with poplar trees
CLEARWING MOTH.diet: Adults do not feed. Caterpillars feed on poplar trees.
CLEARWING MOTH.behavior: Diurnal. Mimics wasps. Flies from May to July.
CLEARWING MOTH.lifecycle: Eggs laid on poplar trees. Caterpillars bore into tree trunks.

CLEOPATRA.description: Medium-sized butterfly with yellow wings (males) or greenish-white wings (females), and distinctive shape.
CLEOPATRA.distribution: Europe, from Mediterranean to southern England
CLEOPATRA.behavior: Strong flier. Flies from March to October. Overwinters as adult.
CLEOPATRA.lifecycle: Eggs laid on buckthorn. Green caterpillars feed on leaves.

CLODIUS PARNASSIAN.description: Large butterfly with white wings, black spots, red eye-spots on hindwings, and transparent wing tips.
CLODIUS PARNASSIAN.distribution: Western North America, from Alaska to California
CLODIUS PARNASSIAN.behavior: Slow flier. Flies from May to August. High altitude species.
CLODIUS PARNASSIAN.lifecycle: Eggs laid on stonecrop plants. Caterpillars feed on host plant.

CLOUDED SULPHUR.description: Medium-sized butterfly with yellow wings (males) or white/yellow wings (females), and black borders.
CLOUDED SULPHUR.distribution: North America, from Canada to Mexico
CLOUDED SULPHUR.behavior: Fast flier. Migratory. Multiple generations per year.
CLOUDED SULPHUR.lifecycle: Eggs laid on plants in the Fabaceae family. Green caterpillars feed on leaves.

COMET MOTH.description: Very large moth with yellow and brown wings, long tail-like extensions, and distinctive eye-spots.
COMET MOTH.diet: Adults do not feed. Caterpillars feed on various trees.
COMET MOTH.behavior: Nocturnal. Attracted to lights. Short-lived as adults.
COMET MOTH.lifecycle: Large caterpillars feed on host plants. Cocoons are made of silk.

COMMON BANDED AWL.description: Medium-sized butterfly with brown wings, white bands, and distinctive shape.
COMMON BANDED AWL.distribution: Southeast Asia, from India to Australia
COMMON BANDED AWL.behavior: Fast flier. Flies year-round in tropical areas.
COMMON BANDED AWL.lifecycle: Eggs laid on plants in the Fabaceae family. Caterpillars feed on leaves.

COMMON WOOD-NYMPH.description: Medium-sized butterfly with brown wings, eye-spots on forewings, and yellow patches.
COMMON WOOD-NYMPH.distribution: North America, from Canada to Mexico
COMMON WOOD-NYMPH.diet: Nectar from flowers, tree sap, and rotting fruit
COMMON WOOD-NYMPH.behavior: Slow flier. Flies from June to September. Low flier.
COMMON WOOD-NYMPH.lifecycle: Eggs laid on grasses. Caterpillars feed on host plant. Overwinters as caterpillar.

COPPER TAIL.description: Small butterfly with orange and brown wings, black spots, and copper-colored hindwings.
COPPER TAIL.behavior: Fast flier. Flies from April to October. Multiple generations per year.
COPPER TAIL.lifecycle: Eggs laid on dock and sorrel plants. Green caterpillars feed on leaves.

CRECENT.description: Small butterfly with orange and black wings, crescent-shaped markings, and distinctive pattern.
CRECENT.distribution: North America, from Canada to Mexico
CRECENT.behavior: Fast flier. Multiple generations per year. Flies from April to October.
CRECENT.lifecycle: Eggs laid on plants in the Asteraceae family. Caterpillars feed on leaves.

CRIMSON PATCH.description: Medium-sized butterfly with black wings, red patches, and white spots.
CRIMSON PATCH.distribution: Central and South America, from Mexico to Brazil
CRIMSON PATCH.behavior: Fast flier. Common in gardens. Flies year-round in tropical areas.
CRIMSON PATCH.lifecycle: Eggs laid on plants in the Acanthaceae family. Caterpillars feed on leaves.

DANAID EGGFLY.description: Medium-sized butterfly with brown wings, white spots, and distinctive eye-spots on hindwings.
DANAID EGGFLY.behavior: Fast flier. Mimics toxic species. Flies year-round in tropical areas.
DANAID EGGFLY.lifecycle: Eggs laid on various host plants. Caterpillars feed on leaves.

EASTERN COMA.description: Medium-sized butterfly with orange and black wings, jagged edges, and distinctive pattern.
EASTERN COMA.diet: Nectar from flowers, tree sap, and rotting fruit
EASTERN COMA.behavior: Fast flier. Overwinters as adult. Flies from March to November.
EASTERN COMA.lifecycle: Eggs laid on elm and nettle plants. Spiny caterpillars feed on leaves.

EASTERN DAPPLE WHITE.description: Small butterfly with white wings, green marbling on undersides, and black spots.
EASTERN DAPPLE WHITE.distribution: Western North America, from Canada to Mexico
EASTERN DAPPLE WHITE.behavior: Fast flier. Flies from March to June. Single generation per year.
EASTERN DAPPLE WHITE.lifecycle: Eggs laid on plants in the Brassicaceae family. Green caterpillars feed on leaves.

EASTERN PINE ELFIN.description: Small butterfly with brown wings, green undersides, and white line on hindwings.
EASTERN PINE ELFIN.behavior: Fast flier. Flies from March to May. Low flier.
EASTERN PINE ELFIN.lifecycle: Eggs laid on pine trees. Green caterpillars feed on needles.

ELBOWED PIERROT.description: Small butterfly with black and white wings, orange spots, and distinctive pattern.
ELBOWED PIERROT.distribution: Southeast Asia, from India to Indonesia
ELBOWED PIERROT.behavior: Fast flier. Flies year-round in tropical areas.
ELBOWED PIERROT.lifecycle: Eggs laid on various host plants. Caterpillars feed on leaves.

EMPEROR GUM MOTH.description: Large moth with brown and white patterned wings, and distinctive eye-spots.
EMPEROR GUM MOTH.diet: Adults do not feed. Caterpillars feed on eucalyptus leaves.
EMPEROR GUM MOTH.behavior: Nocturnal. Attracted to lights. Flies from autumn to spring.
EMPEROR GUM MOTH.lifecycle: Large green caterpillars feed on eucalyptus. Cocoons are made of silk.

GARDEN TIGER MOTH.description: Large moth with brown and white patterned wings, orange hindwings, and distinctive tiger-like pattern.
GARDEN TIGER MOTH.behavior: Nocturnal. Attracted to lights. Flies from June to August.
GARDEN TIGER MOTH.lifecycle: Eggs laid on various host plants. Woolly bear caterpillars are common.

GIANT LEOPARD MOTH.description: Large moth with white wings, black spots, and leopard-like pattern.
GIANT LEOPARD MOTH.distribution: North America, from Canada to Mexico
GIANT LEOPARD MOTH.diet: Adults do not feed. Caterpillars feed on various plants.
GIANT LEOPARD MOTH.behavior: Nocturnal. Attracted to lights. Flies from May to August.
GIANT LEOPARD MOTH.lifecycle: Eggs laid on various host plants. Black and red caterpillars with spines.

GLITTERING SAPPHIRE.description: Small butterfly with blue iridescent wings, and distinctive shimmering appearance.
GLITTERING SAPPHIRE.distribution: Africa, from South Africa to East Africa
GLITTERING SAPPHIRE.behavior: Fast flier. Flies year-round in tropical areas.
GLITTERING SAPPHIRE.lifecycle: Eggs laid on various host plants. Caterpillars feed on leaves.

GOLD BANDED.description: Large butterfly with brown wings, gold bands, and distinctive eye-spots.
GOLD BANDED.distribution: Mediterranean region, from Spain to Greece
GOLD BANDED.diet: Nectar from flowers, tree sap, and rotting fruit
GOLD BANDED.behavior: Strong flier. Flies from May to October. Males are territorial.
GOLD BANDED.lifecycle: Eggs laid on strawberry trees. Large caterpillars with spines.

GREAT EGGFLY.description: Medium-sized butterfly with black wings, white spots, and distinctive eye-spots on hindwings.
GREAT EGGFLY.behavior: Fast flier. Flies year-round in tropical areas. Common in gardens.
GREAT EGGFLY.lifecycle: Eggs laid on various host plants. Caterpillars feed on leaves.

GREAT JAY.description: Large butterfly with black and green wings, white spots, and long tail-like extensions.
GREAT JAY.distribution: Southeast Asia, from India to Indonesia
GREAT JAY.behavior: Strong flier. Flies in forest canopy. Males are territorial.
GREAT JAY.lifecycle: Eggs laid on various host plants. Large caterpillars feed on leaves.

GREEN CELLED CATTLEHEART.description: Large butterfly with black wings, green spots, and distinctive pattern.
GREEN CELLED CATTLEHEART.distribution: Central and South America, from Mexico to Brazil
GREEN CELLED CATTLEHEART.behavior: Strong flier. Flies year-round in tropical areas.
GREEN CELLED CATTLEHEART.lifecycle: Eggs laid on Aristolochia plants. Large caterpillars feed on host plant.

GREEN HAIRSTREAK.description: Small butterfly with brown upperwings, green undersides, and white line on hindwings.
GREEN HAIRSTREAK.diet: Nectar from flowers, especially gorse and broom
GREEN HAIRSTREAK.behavior: Fast flier. Flies from April to July. Low flier.
GREEN HAIRSTREAK.lifecycle: Eggs laid on various host plants. Green caterpillars feed on leaves.

GREY HAIRSTREAK.description: Small butterfly with gray wings, orange spots, and white-tipped tail.
GREY HAIRSTREAK.distribution: North America, from Canada to Mexico
GREY HAIRSTREAK.behavior: Fast flier. Multiple generations per year. Flies from March to November.
GREY HAIRSTREAK.lifecycle: Eggs laid on various host plants. Green caterpillars feed on flowers and fruits.

HERCULES MOTH.description: Very large moth with brown and white patterned wings, and distinctive eye-spots.
HERCULES MOTH.diet: Adults do not feed. Caterpillars feed on various trees.
HERCULES MOTH.behavior: Nocturnal. Attracted to lights. Short-lived as adults.
HERCULES MOTH.lifecycle: Very large caterpillars feed on host plants. Cocoons are made of silk.

HUMMING BIRD HAWK MOTH.description: Medium-sized moth with brown wings, orange hindwings, and long proboscis. Hovers like a hummingbird.
HUMMING BIRD HAWK MOTH.behavior: Diurnal. Hovers while feeding. Migratory. Flies year-round in warm areas.
HUMMING BIRD HAWK MOTH.lifecycle: Eggs laid on bedstraw plants. Green caterpillars feed on leaves.

INDRA SWALLOW.description: Large butterfly with black wings, yellow spots, and long tail-like extensions.
INDRA SWALLOW.distribution: Western North America, from Canada to Mexico
INDRA SWALLOW.behavior: Strong flier. Flies from May to August. High altitude species.
INDRA SWALLOW.lifecycle: Eggs laid on plants in the Apiaceae family. Large caterpillars feed on leaves.

IO MOTH.description: Large moth with yellow and pink wings, distinctive eye-spots, and warning colors.
IO MOTH.distribution: North America, from Canada to Mexico
IO MOTH.diet: Adults do not feed. Caterpillars feed on various trees.
IO MOTH.behavior: Nocturnal. Attracted to lights. Flies from May to August.
IO MOTH.lifecycle: Large spiny caterpillars feed on host plants. Cocoons are made of silk.

Iphiclus sister.description: Medium-sized butterfly with brown wings, white bands, and distinctive pattern.
Iphiclus sister.distribution: Central and South America, from Mexico to Brazil
Iphiclus sister.behavior: Fast flier. Flies year-round in tropical areas.
Iphiclus sister.lifecycle: Eggs laid on various host plants. Caterpillars feed on leaves.

JULIA.description: Medium-sized butterfly with orange wings, black borders, and long narrow shape.
JULIA.distribution: Central and South America, from Texas to Brazil
JULIA.behavior: Strong flier. Fast flier. Flies year-round in tropical areas.
JULIA.lifecycle: Eggs laid on passionflower vines. Caterpillars feed on host plant.

LARGE MARBLE.description: Small butterfly with white wings, green marbling on undersides, and black spots.
LARGE MARBLE.distribution: Western North America, from Canada to Mexico
LARGE MARBLE.behavior: Fast flier. Flies from March to June. Single generation per year.
LARGE MARBLE.lifecycle: Eggs laid on plants in the Brassicaceae family. Green caterpillars feed on leaves.

LUNA MOTH.description: Very large moth with green wings, long tail-like extensions, and distinctive eye-spots.
LUNA MOTH.distribution: Eastern North America, from Canada to Mexico
LUNA MOTH.diet: Adults do not feed. Caterpillars feed on various trees.
LUNA MOTH.behavior: Nocturnal. Attracted to lights. Flies from May to July.
LUNA MOTH.lifecycle: Large green caterpillars feed on host plants. Cocoons are made of silk.

MADAGASCAN SUNSET MOTH.description: Large moth with iridescent wings showing rainbow colors, and distinctive tail-like extensions.
MADAGASCAN SUNSET MOTH.diet: Adults do not feed. Caterpillars feed on Omphalea plants.
MADAGASCAN SUNSET MOTH.behavior: Diurnal. Flies during day. Iridescent colors are structural, not from pigments.
MADAGASCAN SUNSET MOTH.lifecycle: Large caterpillars feed on Omphalea. Cocoons are made of silk.

MALACHITE.description: Medium-sized butterfly with green and black wings, and distinctive malachite-like pattern.
MALACHITE.distribution: Central and South America, from Texas to Brazil
MALACHITE.behavior: Fast flier. Flies year-round in tropical areas. Common in gardens.
MALACHITE.lifecycle: Eggs laid on plants in the Acanthaceae family. Caterpillars feed on leaves.

MANGROVE SKIPPER.description: Medium-sized butterfly with dark brown wings, white spots, and distinctive pattern.
MANGROVE SKIPPER.distribution: Central and South America, from Florida to Brazil
MANGROVE SKIPPER.behavior: Fast flier. Flies year-round in tropical areas.
MANGROVE SKIPPER.lifecycle: Eggs laid on mangrove trees. Caterpillars feed on leaves.

MESTRA.description: Medium-sized butterfly with brown wings, orange patches, and white spots.
MESTRA.distribution: Central and South America, from Mexico to Brazil
MESTRA.behavior: Fast flier. Flies year-round in tropical areas.
MESTRA.lifecycle: Eggs laid on various host plants. Caterpillars feed on leaves.

METALMARK.description: Small butterfly with brown wings, metallic spots, and distinctive pattern.
METALMARK.behavior: Fast flier. Flies from May to September. Low flier.
METALMARK.lifecycle: Eggs laid on various host plants. Small caterpillars feed on leaves.

MILBERTS TORTOISESHELL.description: Medium-sized butterfly with orange and black wings, white spots, and jagged edges.
MILBERTS TORTOISESHELL.distribution: North America, from Canada to Mexico
MILBERTS TORTOISESHELL.diet: Nectar from flowers, tree sap, and rotting fruit
MILBERTS TORTOISESHELL.behavior: Fast flier. Overwinters as adult. Flies from March to October.
MILBERTS TORTOISESHELL.lifecycle: Eggs laid on nettle plants. Spiny caterpillars feed on leaves.

MONARCH.description: Large butterfly with orange and black wings, white spots, and distinctive pattern. Famous for migration.
MONARCH.distribution: North and South America, introduced to other regions
MONARCH.behavior: Long-distance migrant. Forms large aggregations. Warning colors indicate toxicity.
MONARCH.lifecycle: Eggs laid on milkweed. Striped caterpillars are toxic. Famous migration to Mexico.

MOURNING CLOAK.description: Large butterfly with dark brown wings, yellow borders, and blue spots.
MOURNING CLOAK.diet: Nectar from flowers, tree sap, and rotting fruit
MOURNING CLOAK.behavior: Overwinters as adult. Flies from March to October. Long-lived.
MOURNING CLOAK.lifecycle: Eggs laid on elm, willow, and poplar trees. Spiny caterpillars feed on leaves.

OLEANDER HAWK MOTH.description: Large moth with green and brown wings, and distinctive eye-spots.
OLEANDER HAWK MOTH.behavior: Nocturnal. Strong flier. Migratory. Attracted to lights.
OLEANDER HAWK MOTH.lifecycle: Large green caterpillars feed on oleander and related plants. Cocoons are made of silk.

ORANGE OAKLEAF.description: Large butterfly with orange and black upperwings, and brown leaf-like undersides for camouflage.
ORANGE OAKLEAF.distribution: Southeast Asia, from India to Indonesia
ORANGE OAKLEAF.behavior: Masters of camouflage. When wings closed, resembles dead leaf. Flies year-round.
ORANGE OAKLEAF.lifecycle: Eggs laid on various host plants. Caterpillars feed on leaves.

ORANGE TIP.description: Small butterfly with white wings, orange tips on forewings (males), and green marbling on undersides.
ORANGE TIP.behavior: Fast flier. Flies from April to June. Single generation per year.
ORANGE TIP.lifecycle: Eggs laid on plants in the Brassicaceae family. Green caterpillars feed on seed pods.

ORCHARD SWALLOW.description: Large butterfly with black wings, white spots, and long tail-like extensions.
ORCHARD SWALLOW.behavior: Strong flier. Common in gardens. Flies year-round in warm areas.
ORCHARD SWALLOW.lifecycle: Eggs laid on citrus trees. Large green caterpillars feed on leaves.

PAINTED LADY.description: Medium-sized butterfly with orange and black wings, white spots, and distinctive pattern.
PAINTED LADY.behavior: Long-distance migrant. Fast flier. Multiple generations per year.
PAINTED LADY.lifecycle: Eggs laid on plants in the Asteraceae family. Spiny caterpillars feed on leaves.

PAPER KITE.description: Large butterfly with white wings, black spots, and distinctive pattern.
PAPER KITE.distribution: Southeast Asia, from Philippines to Indonesia
PAPER KITE.behavior: Slow flier. Flies year-round in tropical areas. Warning colors indicate toxicity.
PAPER KITE.lifecycle: Eggs laid on plants in the Apocynaceae family. Caterpillars are toxic.

PEACOCK.description: Medium-sized butterfly with red and black wings, distinctive eye-spots, and jagged edges.
PEACOCK.behavior: Overwinters as adult. Flies from March to October. Common in gardens.
PEACOCK.lifecycle: Eggs laid on nettle plants. Spiny black caterpillars feed on leaves.

PINE WHITE.description: Medium-sized butterfly with white wings, black spots, and distinctive pattern.
PINE WHITE.distribution: Western North America, from Canada to Mexico
PINE WHITE.behavior: Fast flier. Flies from July to September. Single generation per year.
PINE WHITE.lifecycle: Eggs laid on pine trees. Green caterpillars feed on needles.

PIPEVINE SWALLOW.description: Large butterfly with black wings, blue iridescence, and distinctive pattern.
PIPEVINE SWALLOW.distribution: North America, from Canada to Mexico
PIPEVINE SWALLOW.behavior: Strong flier. Warning colors indicate toxicity. Flies from March to October.
PIPEVINE SWALLOW.lifecycle: Eggs laid on pipevine plants. Red and black caterpillars are toxic.

POLYPHEMUS MOTH.description: Very large moth with brown and tan wings, distinctive eye-spots, and transparent patches.
POLYPHEMUS MOTH.distribution: North America, from Canada to Mexico
POLYPHEMUS MOTH.diet: Adults do not feed. Caterpillars feed on various trees.
POLYPHEMUS MOTH.behavior: Nocturnal. Attracted to lights. Flies from May to July.
POLYPHEMUS MOTH.lifecycle: Large green caterpillars feed on host plants. Cocoons are made of silk.

POPINJAY.description: Medium-sized butterfly with black and white wings, and distinctive pattern.
POPINJAY.distribution: Southeast Asia, from India to Indonesia
POPINJAY.behavior: Fast flier. Flies year-round in tropical areas.
POPINJAY.lifecycle: Eggs laid on various host plants. Caterpillars feed on leaves.

PURPLE HAIRSTREAK.description: Small butterfly with purple upperwings (males) or brown upperwings (females), and orange spots on hindwings.
PURPLE HAIRSTREAK.diet: Nectar from flowers, honeydew from aphids
PURPLE HAIRSTREAK.behavior: Flies from July to August. Perches high in trees. Rarely seen at ground level.
PURPLE HAIRSTREAK.lifecycle: Eggs laid on oak trees. Caterpillars feed on leaves. Overwinters as egg.

PURPLISH COPPER.description: Small butterfly with orange and brown wings, purple sheen, and black spots.
PURPLISH COPPER.distribution: Western North America, from Canada to Mexico
PURPLISH COPPER.behavior: Fast flier. Multiple generations per year. Flies from May to October.
PURPLISH COPPER.lifecycle: Eggs laid on dock and sorrel plants. Green caterpillars feed on leaves.

QUESTION MARK.description: Medium-sized butterfly with orange and black wings, jagged edges, and silver question mark on hindwings.
QUESTION MARK.diet: Nectar from flowers, tree sap, and rotting fruit
QUESTION MARK.behavior: Overwinters as adult. Flies from March to November. Fast flier.
QUESTION MARK.lifecycle: Eggs laid on elm and nettle plants. Spiny caterpillars feed on leaves.

RED ADMIRAL.description: Medium-sized butterfly with black and red wings, white spots, and distinctive pattern.
RED ADMIRAL.distribution: North America, Europe, Asia, and North Africa
RED ADMIRAL.diet: Nectar from flowers, tree sap, and rotting fruit
RED ADMIRAL.behavior: Migratory. Fast flier. Overwinters as adult. Flies from March to November.
RED ADMIRAL.lifecycle: Eggs laid on nettle plants. Spiny caterpillars feed on leaves.

RED CRACKER.description: Medium-sized butterfly with brown and red wings, white spots, and distinctive pattern.
RED CRACKER.distribution: Central and South America, from Mexico to Brazil
RED CRACKER.behavior: Fast flier. Males make cracking sounds with wings. Flies year-round in tropical areas.
RED CRACKER.lifecycle: Eggs laid on various host plants. Caterpillars feed on leaves.

RED POSTMAN.description: Medium-sized butterfly with black and red wings, white spots, and distinctive pattern.
RED POSTMAN.distribution: Central and South America, from Mexico to Brazil
RED POSTMAN.behavior: Slow flier. Warning colors indicate toxicity. Flies year-round in tropical areas.
RED POSTMAN.lifecycle: Eggs laid on passionflower vines. Caterpillars are toxic.

RED SPOTTED PURPLE.description: Large butterfly with black wings, blue iridescence, and red spots on hindwings.
RED SPOTTED PURPLE.diet: Nectar from flowers, tree sap, and rotting fruit
RED SPOTTED PURPLE.behavior: Fast flier. Flies from May to September. Mimics toxic species.
RED SPOTTED PURPLE.lifecycle: Eggs laid on cherry and poplar trees. Spiny caterpillars feed on leaves.

ROSY MAPLE MOTH.description: Small moth with pink and yellow wings, and distinctive pattern.
ROSY MAPLE MOTH.distribution: Eastern North America, from Canada to Florida
ROSY MAPLE MOTH.diet: Adults do not feed. Caterpillars feed on maple and oak trees.
ROSY MAPLE MOTH.behavior: Nocturnal. Attracted to lights. Flies from May to August.
ROSY MAPLE MOTH.lifecycle: Large green and yellow caterpillars feed on host plants. Cocoons are made of silk.

SCARCE SWALLOW.description: Large butterfly with yellow and black wings, blue spots, and long tail-like extensions.
SCARCE SWALLOW.behavior: Strong flier. Flies from April to September. Males are territorial.
SCARCE SWALLOW.lifecycle: Eggs laid on fruit trees. Large green caterpillars feed on leaves.

SILVER SPOT SKIPPER.description: Small butterfly with brown wings, silver spots, and distinctive pattern.
SILVER SPOT SKIPPER.behavior: Fast flier. Flies from July to September. Low flier.
SILVER SPOT SKIPPER.lifecycle: Eggs laid on grasses. Caterpillars feed on host plant. Overwinters as egg.

SIXSPOT BURNET MOTH.description: Medium-sized moth with black wings, red spots, and distinctive warning colors.
SIXSPOT BURNET MOTH.behavior: Diurnal. Flies during day. Warning colors indicate toxicity. Flies from June to August.
SIXSPOT BURNET MOTH.lifecycle: Eggs laid on plants in the Fabaceae family. Yellow and black caterpillars are toxic.

SLEEPY ORANGE.description: Small butterfly with orange wings, black borders, and distinctive pattern.
SLEEPY ORANGE.distribution: North America, from Canada to Mexico
SLEEPY ORANGE.behavior: Fast flier. Multiple generations per year. Flies from March to November.
SLEEPY ORANGE.lifecycle: Eggs laid on plants in the Fabaceae family. Green caterpillars feed on leaves.

SOOTYWING.description: Small butterfly with dark brown or black wings, white spots, and distinctive pattern.
SOOTYWING.habitat: Open areas, fields, and disturbed areas
SOOTYWING.distribution: North America, from Canada to Mexico
SOOTYWING.behavior: Fast flier. Multiple generations per year. Flies from April to October.
SOOTYWING.lifecycle: Eggs laid on plants in the Chenopodiaceae family. Small caterpillars feed on leaves.

SOUTHERN DOGFACE.description: Medium-sized butterfly with yellow wings, black borders, and dog face-like pattern on forewings.
SOUTHERN DOGFACE.behavior: Fast flier. Multiple generations per year. Flies year-round in warm areas.
SOUTHERN DOGFACE.lifecycle: Eggs laid on plants in the Fabaceae family. Green caterpillars feed on leaves.

STRAITED QUEEN.description: Medium-sized butterfly with orange and black wings, white spots, and distinctive pattern.
STRAITED QUEEN.distribution: North and South America, from United States to Brazil
STRAITED QUEEN.behavior: Fast flier. Warning colors indicate toxicity. Flies year-round in warm areas.
STRAITED QUEEN.lifecycle: Eggs laid on milkweed. Striped caterpillars are toxic.

TROPICAL LEAFWING.description: Large butterfly with brown wings, orange patches, and leaf-like pattern on undersides.
TROPICAL LEAFWING.distribution: Central and South America, from Mexico to Brazil
TROPICAL LEAFWING.behavior: Strong flier. Masters of camouflage. Flies year-round in tropical areas.
TROPICAL LEAFWING.lifecycle: Eggs laid on various host plants. Large caterpillars feed on leaves.

TWO BARRED FLASHER.description: Medium-sized butterfly with brown wings, white bars, and distinctive pattern.
TWO BARRED FLASHER.distribution: Central and South America, from Mexico to Brazil
TWO BARRED FLASHER.behavior: Fast flier. Flies year-round in tropical areas.
TWO BARRED FLASHER.lifecycle: Eggs laid on various host plants. Caterpillars feed on leaves.

ULYSES.description: Large butterfly with brilliant blue upperwings and black borders, and brown undersides.
ULYSES.distribution: Northeastern Australia, Papua New Guinea, and Indonesia
ULYSES.behavior: Strong flier. Males are territorial. Protected species in Australia.
ULYSES.lifecycle: Eggs laid on various host plants. Large green caterpillars feed on leaves.

VICEROY.description: Medium-sized butterfly with orange and black wings, white spots, and distinctive pattern. Mimics Monarch.
VICEROY.distribution: North America, from Canada to Mexico
VICEROY.diet: Nectar from flowers, tree sap, and rotting fruit
VICEROY.behavior: Fast flier. Mimics toxic Monarch butterfly. Flies from May to October.
VICEROY.lifecycle: Eggs laid on willow and poplar trees. Spiny caterpillars feed on leaves.

WHITE LINED SPHINX MOTH.description: Large moth with brown and white wings, pink hindwings, and distinctive pattern.
WHITE LINED SPHINX MOTH.distribution: North America, from Canada to Mexico
WHITE LINED SPHINX MOTH.behavior: Nocturnal and crepuscular. Hovers like hummingbird. Attracted to lights.
WHITE LINED SPHINX MOTH.lifecycle: Large green caterpillars feed on various host plants. Cocoons are made of silk.

WOOD SATYR.description: Medium-sized butterfly with brown wings, eye-spots, and distinctive pattern.
WOOD SATYR.behavior: Slow flier. Flies from May to September. Low flier.
WOOD SATYR.lifecycle: Eggs laid on grasses. Caterpillars feed on host plant. Overwinters as caterpillar.

YELLOW SWALLOW TAIL.description: Large butterfly with yellow and black wings, blue spots, and long tail-like extensions.
YELLOW SWALLOW TAIL.behavior: Strong flier. Flies from April to September. Males are territorial.
YELLOW SWALLOW TAIL.lifecycle: Eggs laid on plants in the Apiaceae family. Large green caterpillars feed on leaves.

ZEBRA LONG WING.description: Medium-sized butterfly with black wings, yellow stripes, and long narrow shape.
ZEBRA LONG WING.distribution: Central and South America, from Texas to Brazil, and Florida
ZEBRA LONG WING.diet: Nectar from flowers, especially Lantana, and pollen
ZEBRA LONG WING.behavior: Slow flier. Long-lived. Warning colors indicate toxicity. Flies year-round in tropical areas.
ZEBRA LONG WING.lifecycle: Eggs laid on passionflower vines. Striped caterpillars are toxic. Adults can live for months.
